poem:
Title: Ode to Journeys Yet Taken

Globe-circling youth, striding forward fitful,
In flights of restless and hopeful spittle.
Their path, like fleeting film sequences, 
Bleeds through borders and societal fences. 
Eduardo paints a second-hand song,
Of ghostly part two that'll never belong.
Yet, in these peregrinations' rise and fall,
Twentysomethings find life's subtle call. 
A journey felt, more than seen,
Eternities embraced in the nothings in-between.
